ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with this course compared to others you have taken was:
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
How would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other F&ES courses you have taken?
Given the course objectives, the level of intellectual challenge of the material covered was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Theoretical foundation of statistics and practical skills of data analysis
I learned R, which I had never used before.

narratives.question_text: How well did the knowledge, skills, and insights gained in this class align with your expectations?
comments: Well above my expectations. I not only acquired how to do analysis in R, but also had a deeper understanding of how to understand the logic behind research and possible ethical problems (like lying with data).

I wish the class had included more projects throughout the course. This class was the largest lecture class I took this semester (and hope to ever take while in graduate school) but I felt like the Professor did a good job.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of the course and how could it be improved?
comments: Overall the course was well organized and structured. Theories were clearly stated, and examples helped a lot in understanding the significance of theories in the real world. TA sections were extremely helpful. The only improvement could be shortening the time for repetitive homework.
weakness: unorganized & disordered & inconsistent teaching style & confusing annotation

The class was too big. I think the course could have been improved by having multiple smaller sections. In particular, I think splitting the course into graduate and undergraduate students would give graduate students more chances to apply what we learned to our work compared with just having one final project at the end.

narratives.question_text: What advice would you give to a student considering taking this class?
comments: This class requires strong self-learning ability

Underlying statistics / theory were more important on the midterm and final than the rest of the course. I was able to do very well on all of the homework but struggled with the exams because of focus much more time on coding compared with the underlying statistical concepts.
